item.title: Visit of Pope Francis for the World Meeting of Families 2018
item.description: Visit of Pope Francis for the World Meeting of Families 2018 We will run our normal scheduled Sunday service on 26 August. Diversions will be in place on these services and more information will be available closer to the event date.  In addition to this, Dublin Bus will have dedicated transport hubs, throughout the city, to bring you as close as possible to the Phoenix Park.   Regular services...

item.title: Diversions due to Marlay Park Concerts
item.description: We wish to advise customers that due to the Bruno Mars Concert and Longitude Festival on Thursday 12, Friday 13, Saturday 14 and Sunday 15 July 2018, the following diversions will be in place from 22.00hrs until last bus each day; Route 16 Towards Ballinteer Normal route to Rathfarnham Road, divert left to Nutgrove Avenue and terminate the Bottle Tower Pub. item.title: Temporary Stop Closure on Swords Main Street
item.description: We wish to advise customers that due to water pipe works, stop 3690 on Swords Main Street will be not be in use from Thursday 12 July for approx 3 weeks.  For your nearest stop please proceed to stop 3689 on Swords Main Street. See map below for stop location. Customers can also get updates on  Facebook , follow us on Twitter  @dublinbusnews  or call our customer service line on (01) 8734222,...

item.description: We wish to advise customers that due to footpath restoration works, Cornelscourt Hill Road will be closed  between 08.00hrs and 18.00hrs, Monday to Friday,  from Monday 16 July until Friday 24 August 2018. item.title: Diversions due to Roadworks at Swords Village
item.description: We wish to advise customers that due to water mains replacement works, the below diversions will be in place on Routes 33, 33a, 41c. 41x and 102 from Monday 25 June until further notice.   Route 41c/x to Swords Manor: Divert from Forest Road right on to Dublin Road, left on to R132, left on to Malahide Road to Main Street and back on to normal route. Route 102 to Sutton: Divert from Forest Road...

item.title: Kids Go Free
item.description: There will be two weeks of Kids go Free this July.  How does it work? Simply use your Child Leap Card as normal and you won’t be charged. Any Child Leap Card (5-15 or 16-18) can be used to get free travel from Monday 2nd July until Sunday the 15th July (inclusive) provided it has at least 1 cent Travel Credit. The Kids go Free applies to DART and Luas services, however, Airlink, Tours, Nitelink...

item.title: Diversions due to Malahide Has It Festival
item.description: We wish to advise customers that due to Malahide Has It Festival, New Street is will be closed from 17.00hrs on Friday 27 July to 23.30hrs on Sunday 29 July 2018. As a result the following diversion will be in place; Route 32 Towards Malahide Normal route to Portmarnock, left onto Wendell Avenue, Blackwood Lane, Church Road, right on the Mall Road and terminate in Malahide Village.  Towards...

item.title: Diversion on Route 15
item.description: We wish to advise customers that due to roadworks the Knocklyon Road outbound will be closed from Monday 2 July 2018 for approximately 8 weeks. As a result the following diversion are in place; Route 15 Towards Ballycullen Road Normal route to Knocklyon Road, divert via Templeroan Road, right to Schloarstown Road and back on to normal route.  Stops 1143, 1144 and 1145 will not be in use during...

item.title: Diversion on Route 40
item.description: We wish to advise customers that due to road resurfacing, Casement Road will be closed from 10.00hrs on Monday 2 July 2018 for approximately two weeks. As a result the following diversions will be in place; Route 40 Towards Charlestown  Normal route to Barry Road, divert right to Barry Avenue, Casement Road South and back on to normal route. item.title: Children paint a bright future with Dublin Bus
item.description: Over 100 primary school students from the Mid West of Dublin attended the 2018 Dublin Bus Children’s Art Competition Awards at City Services Social Club, Clondalkin.  The art competition is part of an overall campaign by Dublin Bus to promote the concept of respecting public transport amongst school children. A total of four regional ceremonies will take place throughout the week to celebrate t...

item.title: Customer Safety is the First Stop for Ireland’s Largest Public Transport Provider
item.description: With almost 140 million customers carried last year, it’s no wonder that safety awareness is high on the priority list for Dublin Bus. Today, the company launched a new customer awareness video, a support for all bus users to ensure they are travelling safely and smartly and aware of the needs of fellow customers. View the video here Dublin Bus carries 72% of commuters during peak hours on over...

item.title: Diversion on Route 31a

item.title: Diversions on Route 61 and Route 161
item.description: We wish to advise customers that due to emergency roadworks by South Dublin County Council on Edmondstown Road, Routes 61 and 161 are unable to serve Rockbrook terminus from Thursday 16 November 2017 for a period of several months. item.title: Dublin Bus proud to sponsor Bike Locker initiative
item.description: Dublin Bus is proud to partner with South Dublin County Council as official sponsors of bikelocker.ie‘s new locker facilities beside our bus stop 2234, Lucan.  This initiative provides customers with a more attractive overall network by pairing the bus with increased cycle facilities. If you live in the Lucan area then the fastest way to get to Dublin City is by Bus. Dublin Bus Routes 25,...

item.title: Dublin Bus and Social Media
item.description: Dublin Bus are now Tweeting. Dublin Bus Twitter Content Policy: We want people to feel comfortable and happy to be in our social space. We want @DublinBusNews to be a forum for everyone. The tweets should be respectful and contain language that is appropriate for all groups and ages. If necessary we reserve the right to block and report tweets that are obscene, indecent; contain threats or...
